channel.title: teach on TheDataAreClean
channel.description: Recent content in teach on TheDataAreClean

item.title: The Data Are Clean
item.description: __ Today I want to talk about a topic that is closely intertwined with my identity, specifically my online identity. I am talking about TheDataAreClean, my username literally everyone one the internet. A couple of place I had to use an underscore at the end (mostly due to my mistake), and I am still annoyed about that. The story of why I picked this name is really short, but I have to fill this blog with some content.

item.title: Teaching Teaching
item.description: __ One reason amongst many others I care about the education space is my experience with teachers. When I think back to my school or college, I can remember one, maybe two teachers that had any impact on shaping my academic career. All those interactions just toughened me up to not tolerate a lot of bullshit in life. To be fair, I wasn’t a great kid either. I was a menace, always talking in the classroom, making difficult for any teacher to teach me.

item.title: Teaching / Learning
item.description: __ Teaching Recently I have been doing some R session for the folks at my workplace. It’s only been a couple of weeks but it’s made me think about a lot of things. About how so much of teaching involves learning and relearning, about condensing all the information into meaningful sessions, about how teaching is fucking rewarding and why don’t I do it more often? There is a lot to unpack here, let’s tackle all of them one by one.
